Node.definition: = state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= a relatively small quantity of food
= state in which food is free from moisture or liquid

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to put to shame|to bring shame
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to forfeit the respect of the community, by provoking a situation that is not in accordance to that person's status
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
= process by which humans receive a portion of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided
= a container, ◄ made of hardened clay, ► used for the smelting of ore; ≈ associated with times of testing and trial
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

= a construction ◄ made of hardened clay or of bricks ► and used for the smelting of ore or the firing of ceramic ware; ≈ often used figuratively to denote a prolonged period of hardship; also associated with times of testing and trial
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

= action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to act wickedly|to do wickedness|to do evil
Node.definition: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= to agree to a request or command and perform it
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life
only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures
= state of being needy as a result of one's lack of monetary or physical resources, usually resulting in a lower social status with little authority or power and at the risk of being exploited

Node.gloss: to reproach|to taunt|to insult|to defy|to blaspheme
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

Node.gloss: to be free|to be innocent|to go unpunished
Node.definition: = state or process in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection
= a person who is nearing the end of a relatively long life; ≈ regarded as wise, worthy of respect, and an asset to the community
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself
= state in which human speech is of an excellent quality

marker pointing to information that substantiates a particular assertion even more conclusively than previous information, which was presented in an immediately preceding utterance as an valid substantiation of that assertion
= member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= small object ◄ consisting of a variety of stone that is considered precious because of its beauty and scarcity; ► used as ornament or decoration; ≈ association with honor, majesty, and glory
= state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others
= an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do
literally: to cover; hence: = action by which humans or deities no longer hold (other) humans responsible for certain actions
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
= affection between people, or between people and deities
= causative action by which humans or deities separate one or more (other) humans or animals from a larger group
= person, male or female, with whom one has a special bond, such as friendship, marriage, a covenant, etc., ≈ usually regarded with affection and seen as trustworthy
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals
= causative action by which deities commission one or more people to go to a certain individual or place to inflict punishment

= large mammal with thick fur and a rather doglike face; walks on all fours but may stand up on its back legs to get a better view; maybe 2 meters tall when standing up and weigh over 200 kilos; feeds on roots, berries, wild fruit, mice, and lizards, and, occasionally, small livestock; ◄ |iUrsus arctos syriacus|i*; ► dangerous when provoked or robbed of cubs; ≈ associated with violence and danger
= state in which humans or animals have lost one or more of their offspring

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

Node.gloss: to repay|to pay back|to punish|to reward
Node.definition: literally: to send back (to someone); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities case (other) humans or deities to receive the appropriate return for their actions, which can be either good or bad
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
literally: to detach itself (from a someone or somewhere); hence: = process by which a certain event stops taking place
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= point in time at which an event starts happening
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
= process by which an event takes place suddenly

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
= causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans to conform to an accepted code of behavior

Node.gloss: to declare guilty|to condemn as guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities declare (other) humans guilty before God or humanity, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= people, animals, and inanimate objects that are considered utterly wrong and detestable, because of their condition, their behavior, or because of certain customs
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something

Node.gloss: to hold, carry, have (in one's luggage)
Node.definition: literally: in (one's) hand; hence: = state of carrying an object physically in one's hand or as part of one's luggage

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

Node.gloss: to acquire|to obtain|to purchase|to buy|to reclaim
Node.definition: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way|literally: to acquire; hence: = action by which humans acquire a certain quality
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: at all time; = a long stretch of time, without any interruptions
= person to which one directs one's feelings of affection
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= fellow member of the same group of people, not necessarily relatives, sharing a bond of affection, employment, or a common purpose
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans lack a particular quality that they are supposed to have
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do

= causative action by which someone strikes the palm of their hand against someone else's palm; ► in order to show that one has taken responsibility for someone else's debts; ≈ usually regarded as unwise
exact meaning unsure, possibly: = to strike the palm of one's hand against the hand of someone else usually a creditor to indicate that one has accepted the responsibility for another person's debt

Node.gloss: to pledge|to promise|to put up security
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security
= action by which humans take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= action by which two parties are engaged in a violent struggle involving physical force
= state in which a human being or deity causes an object to be of great or more than average height
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
literally: to be crooked (of an event); hence: = state in which an event is considered morally and/or ethically unacceptable
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= process by which humans, deities, or objects take on a different nature, character, or form
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans become suddenly involved in a certain difficult situation
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= process by which males among humans and animals generate offspring

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
literally: to make good; hence: = causative action by which humans cause a certain activity to take place with enhanced intensity and quality
= state in which someone enjoys a good health
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
literally: a broken spirit; hence: = a state in which someone's inner person has been deeply affected by grief, the impact of which is compared an object that has been crushed into small pieces
= process by which someone is caused to lose vital energy ◄ due to anxiety or some trouble
= any of the pieces of hard, whitish tissue that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength
= an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person
literally: (in/from one's) bosom; hence: = a state in which an event is unknown to others
literally: to bend (justice); hence: = causative action by which humans alter their way of behavior in such a way that it no longer conforms to established norms and patterns
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= practices that conform to the laws of God
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their heart (לֵב) ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else|= causative action by which humans cause (other) humans or deities to experience displeasure ◄ by their words or behavior
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just
= state in which humans are morally and ethically right

Node.gloss: to withhold|to hold back|to be reluctant
Node.definition: = action by which humans keep part of their body to themselves, refusing to use it to perform a particular event
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
literally: precious; hence: = state in which an event happens at a very low frequency
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event
= to cover part of the body so that it cannot perform some function

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
